hints.content: Let's use the place value blocks on the chart to help us solve.

We can put our two numbers together on the place value chart.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/6593e23c9506e7f76f81704104ff335cadaafe1b)

There are $8\text{ hundreds}, 11\text{ tens}$ and $12\text{ ones}$.

We can take our $12\text{ ones}$ and make $1\text{ ten}$ and $2\text{ ones}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/79ed61b2d8e868fac937e242e7579382e4c71475)

Now, we have $8\text{ hundreds}, 12\text{ tens}$ and $2\text{ ones}$.

We can take our $12\text{ tens}$ and turn them into $1\text{ hundred}$ and $2\text{ tens}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/617b5657736d4c9e33956373a38e024fd09a6841)

In all, there are $9\text{ hundreds}, 2\text{ tens}$ and $2\text{ ones}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/165d666e642bdf3ad983edaf2f5f4ed3f54399a0)

$900 + 20 + 2= 922$

question.content:
**Add.**  
*Hint: Use the place value blocks to help solve.*

$\Large{\purpleD{683} + \maroonD{239} ={}}$[[☃ numeric-input 1]]
